body:
I'm not suggesting you have to read all of each page, but the very first things on each of those links explains how to check out the code.

You say

> http://golang.org/doc/contribute.html assumes that you already has code and starts with discussing testing.

But the very first sentence on that page is:

> This document explains how to contribute changes to the Go project. It assumes you have followed the [installation instructions](https://golang.org/doc/install/source)

I don't want to repeat the checkout instructions everywhere, because if/when they change we need to update them everywhere.
